alert.note: Alert for Baldwin; Butler; Conecuh; Covington; Crenshaw; Escambia; Monroe (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued April 05 at 11:15AM CDT until April 05 at 12:00PM CDT by NWS Mobile
info.description: The National Weather Service in Mobile has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Southern Butler County in south central Alabama... South central Monroe County in south central Alabama... North central Baldwin County in southwestern Alabama... Southern Crenshaw County in south central Alabama... Escambia County in south central Alabama... Conecuh County in south central Alabama... Covington County in south central Alabama... * Until noon CDT. * At 1114 AM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near McKenzie to 7 miles northeast of Stockton, moving east at 40 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Hail damage to vehicles is expected. Expect wind damage to roofs, siding, and trees. * Locations impacted include... Andalusia, Atmore, Brewton, Evergreen, McCullough, East Brewton, Uriah, Brantley, McKenzie, River Falls, Castleberry, Excel, Red Level, Dozier, Repton, Heath, Gantt, Pollard, Riverview and I65 And US 84. TORNADO...POSSIBLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 200 PM CDT for south central and southwestern Alabama. For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 200 PM CDT for south central and southwestern Alabama.

area.areaDesc: Baldwin; Butler; Conecuh; Covington; Crenshaw; Escambia; Monroe
